summary: For decades, drones have helped the Department of the Interior manage remote federal lands and navigate hazardous conditions, such as wildfires. Since FY 2020, Interior has been revising its policies to restrict the purchase and use of certain foreign-made drones due to potential security risks. Today, Interior is allowed to use them, but generally still isn't allowed to buy more of them. This Q&A report...
title: Federal Lands: Effects of Interior's Policies on Foreign-Made Drones
